WRITING.TEXT:
It has become a part of the way I draw, I just enjoy them and like the way that they look. I dont do it all the time tough. http://snapwidget.com/v/1184678905936178694
But I sort of like something sort of massive or scary standing on a very fragile base.
Lets just say that the legs are not your bag of potatoes ;) I however love mixing animals with insect like parts.
Yea I know about that "tradition" and that sort if fit this picture perfectly even though I didnt really think about it when I did it :)
Yea I know, I could probably have done less creepy legs on this one ;)
Yea I do a lot of these legs, I dont know why but I could have done less creepy legs on this ones haha. Sorry :P
Ill pm you
Ill be waiting ;)
I think I sent you an answer just now :)
Yea sort of, I dont know haha.

I dont know what to tell you to be honest, I started drawing before I could walk properly and then I learn as many styles as possible. Then a series of circumstances pushed me in the direction Im in now. So with that said I guess my answer is this. Practice all kinds of classical styles really hard then be lucky and find your own thing. Also, draw every day like some crazy person. :)

Come to Japan and then I can do it. If somebody else would do it, know this... This style is really not made for tattooing which makes it take a really long time and hard to pull off. The artist needs to be really good to pull it off.
Usually I dont but sometimes the planets align and stuff.
Yepp I do, https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/
Try not to go insane looking for it :)
I like Japan and I live in Japan
Copics, and copic caligraphy pen and then ballpoint pens ;)
Thanks man, I'll be waiting ;)
Thank you, First it's a pilot hi-tec ballpoint pen and then I use some Copic caligraphy pen for the thicker outlines and both works well with copic markers.
Copics
Harry the warlock dog, yepp that was me :)
I see, Thank you
If Im not missunderstanding you now, you think this would offend Japanese people? if so, I live and work in Japan and my wife is Japanese and she loves this :P
Ill Pm you
Haha you spoke well in your condition. It means a lot to hear this, thanks man :)
Thats a nice way of putting it :)
Yey, thank you!
Thanks, glad to hear it!
Thank you :) Ill pm you
Purely aesthetic, I just cant not do them for some reason haha
Thank you, But what about it?
Thanks man! Im glad to hear that it has become recognizable, That must mean that Im doing something right :)
I hope in a good way haha
Thank you, I have worked hard to develop this style :)
Thank you!

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you :)
Enjoy!
alrighty! https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/
Thank you sir!
Thank you, glad to hear it!

Thank you! Well I have been drawing since I was a small child and this style in particular that I have developed is something I have been doing for around 4 years now. with that said it takes me around 3-4 hours to finish something like this. But you need to consider all the years it took to get where Im at I guess (speedwise).
Haha I think Ill be alright ;) Thank you
Thank you
I dont really use facebook but I have an instagram though :) https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/
Naa, I just like the ascetics of it and it adds a little bit of darkness to the cat. :)
Yepp! this is where I post my Sketches Coffee series: (Which this is a part of) https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/
Haha nope nothing, This is just my honest imagination. :) Thank you!
Sound like a lot of fun actually, Ill give it a try soonish :)
Ill have to give it a try then :) I use a simple Pilot hi-tec ballpoint pen so nothing fancy at all, But its very smooth ink and it works well with copics.
I haven't played that yet, is it worth playing?
Thank you! I think you have to pm me :)

WRITING.TITLE: Backyard Murder, Ink and Copics, A4

WRITING.TEXT: Tokyo ;)
Kichijoji/Tokyo
Yes, but I was just playing dead.

Haha you have no idea how important that ballpoint pen is to me. The artwork is later scanned and made into long lasting prints. I'm extremly particular about my ball point pen, it's actually a huge part of how this style came to be. It's something about the roll speed that allows me to work the way I do. The only cheap part of my art supply is the pen. Thank you for the advice never the less. By the way, have you seen Shohei Otomos work? Also ballpoint pen :)
Thank you!

Thank you! I sort of feel like a bastard child to Ralph Steadman haha, if you watch the short documentary about "For No Good Reason" you see how he works and its very very similar to the mindset I work in. Just going for it and play with what you get.
Im glad that I invoked that feeling!
Yes I guess I do :)

Thank you, I used to only work digitally as well but I straight up got fed up with sitting infront of a computer screen all day long. I find it much more rewarding to have an actual page with pressure marks from the pen and everything instead of a .jpg or .eps to lean back on :) Its very soothing to draw far away from screens
